author: PTI
title: Indian Army Engineers Reconnect Sikkim Villages with Speedy Suspension Bridge | Science-Environment
text:
Indian Army Engineers Reconnect Sikkim Villages with Speedy Suspension Bridge Engineers of the Indian Army swiftly built a 150-ft-long suspension bridge over waters in north Sikkim, reconnecting villages cut off by heavy rains. Constructed by the Trishakti Corps, the bridge was completed in under 48 hours, enabling movement and providing relief to the affected locals. PTI | New Delhi | Updated: 23-06-2024 22:44 IST | Created: 23-06-2024 22:44 IST
AI Generated Representative Image Country: India SHARE In a remarkable feat of engineering, Indian Army engineers from the Trishakti Corps have constructed a 150-ft-long suspension bridge to reconnect villages in north Sikkim that were isolated due to heavy rains.
The challenging project, aimed at reconnecting the cut-off areas and providing much-needed relief to the locals, underscores the Army's technical expertise and swift response capabilities.
The bridge, completed in less than 48 hours over rapidly flowing waters, now facilitates the movement of people and the delivery of essential relief materials to the affected areas.
(This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)
